summary: An Ordinance specifying and adopting a system or plan of Municipal Street Railways for the City of Seattle, declaring the estimated cost thereof, as near as may be authorizing the incurring of indebtedness by the issuance of General Bonds in the sum of One Million Two Hundred Seventy-two Thousand Dollars ($1,272.000.00) and the issuance of Special Bonds in the sum of Three Million Dollars ($3,000.000.00), to provide funds for the construction of such system, or portions thereof, providing for the payment of said General Bonds, and creating a fund to be known as the City Street Railway Fund, to secure the repayment of said Special Bonds and submitting such plan or system for ratification or rejection to the qualifier voters of the City of Seattle at a special election to be held on the 12th day of September, A. D. 1906.
